bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8393) to enable the people of Puerto Rico to choose a permanent, nonterritorial, fully self-governing political status for Puerto Rico and to provide for a transition to and the implementation of that permanent, nonterritorial, fully self-governing political status, and for other purposes.
bill.description: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 8393) to enable the people of Puerto Rico to choose a permanent, nonterritorial, fully self-governing political status for Puerto Rico and to provide for a transition to and the implementation of that permanent, nonterritorial, fully self-governing political status, and for other purposes.

history.action: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 117-643, by Mr. McGovern.
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 8393 with 1 hour of general debate. Motion to recommit allowed. Bill is closed to amendments.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 166.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H9859-9863)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1519.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217 - 201 (Roll no. 527). (text: CR H9859)
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
